{{Infobox Organization |name = DisAbled Women's Network Canada Jump to: navigation, search |image = |image_border = |size = |caption = |map = |msize = |mcaption = |abbreviation = DAWN |motto = |formation = June 20–23, 1985, |extinction = |type = Women's Organization |status = active |purpose = advocate and public voice, educator and network |headquarters = [[Montréal]], [[Québec]] |location = |region_served = [[Canada]] |membership = |language = [[English Language|English]]
[[French language|French]] |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = [http://www.dawncanada.net/ENG/ENGwelcome.htm DAWN Canada] |remarks = }} {{Disability}} '''DAWN Canada/Réseau d'action des femmes handicapées du Canada ''' is a Canadian national [[feminist]] network controlled by and composed of women who self-identify as women with disabilities.Doucette, Joanne. ''The DisAbled Women's Network: A Fragile Success'', in ''Women and Social Change: Feminist Activism in Canada'', eds: Wine & Ristock, James Lorimer & co. 1991, {{ISBN|1-55028-356-1}}, p221 The network also supports local and provincial chapters. DAWN is a member organization of the [[National Action Committee on the Status of Women]], Canada's largest feminist organization. ==History== The organization began on June 20–23, 1985, at a meeting between seventeen women from across Canada who came together to discuss issues of interest to women with various disabilities.Pelletier, Jacqueline. ''Report: Women with Disabilities'', in [http://www.dawncanada.net/ENG/ENGnational.htm DAWN Canada] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080723175655/http://www.dawncanada.net/ENG/ENGnational.htm |date=July 23, 2008 }} The main purpose of this initial meeting was to plan a larger national gathering of disabled women who would then develop the organization's strategies and goals. Early groups formed in [[Prince Edward Island]], [[Toronto]], [[City of Halifax|Halifax]], [[British Columbia]], and [[Montreal]] and in [[Winnipeg]], that city's existing group for women with disabilities, the [[Consulting Committee on the Status of Women with Disabilities]] also joined the network.Doucette, Joanne. ''The DisAbled Women's Network: A Fragile Success'', in ''Women and Social Change: Feminist Activism in Canada'', eds: Wine & Ristock, James Lorimer & co. 1991, {{ISBN|1-55028-356-1}}, p224 ==Mission== DAWN Canada's mission is "to end the poverty, isolation, discrimination and violence experienced by women with disabilities, and to fight for women with disabilities to have freedom of choice in all aspects of their lives."[http://www.dawncanada.net/ENG/ENGmission.htm DAWN Mission] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070629191457/http://www.dawncanada.net/ENG/ENGmission.htm |date=June 29, 2007 }} ==References== {{reflist|1}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080515085805/http://www.dawncanada.net/ENG/ENGwelcome.htm DAWN Canada] {{DEFAULTSORT:Disabled Women's Network Canada}} [[Category:Disability rights organizations]] [[Category:Feminist organizations in Canada]] [[Category:Intersectional feminism]] [[Category:Women's organizations based in Canada]] [[Category:Disability organizations based in Canada]] {{charity-stub}}

{{Unreferenced|article|date=August 2011}}
The '''European Land Information Service''' provides direct access to official land registers in Europe. '''EULIS''' is owned by a consortium of member countries with expertise in the area of [[land registration]], most of which are [[Public ownership|government organisations]]. EULIS was an initiative led by the official bodies for land registration in European countries.
== History == ===The EULIS project 2001-2004===
Between 2001 and 2004 eight different European land information organisations and one university cooperated in developing a demonstrator e-platform for subscribed users of land registries with support and additional funding from the [[European Commission]]. In addition the team worked hard to produce online reference information from each participating country.
===The EULIS programme 2004-2007===
The long term aim was to help encourage cross-border lending on the Integration of EU Mortgage Credit Markets. The three-year programme developed the demonstrator into a live service that was officially launched as a live service on 22 November 2006.
===The EULIS portal 2007-2017===
The EULIS portal was in the air until May 2017. At that moment in time it was decided by the members to close the portal. Main reason for the closure was the fact that EU-Commission was building a replacing portal under the Land Registers Interconnection Programme. In 2018 the EULIS organization was abolished.
=== European supporters === EULIS is a concept supported by various organisations in the European community. EULIS enjoys active discussion and cooperation with many of these organisations including the [[European Commission]], [[European Mortgage Federation]], [[European Land Registry Association]], [[Eurogeographics]], and the [[European Business Register]].
==EULIS tools==
The EULIS glossary and reference information assist better understanding of the local environment, not only literally but also the meaning of terminology.
==References== {{Reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2011}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Eulis}} [[Category:Real property law]]

{{Unreferenced|date=May 2011}} In [[Anglo-Saxon law]], an '''exclusive right''', or '''exclusivity''', is a de facto, non-tangible [[prerogative]] existing in law (that is, the [[power (sociology)|power]] or, in a wider sense, [[right]]) to perform an action or acquire a benefit and to permit or deny others the right to perform the same action or to acquire the same benefit. A "prerogative" is in effect an exclusive right. The term is restricted for use for official state or sovereign (i.e., constitutional) powers. Exclusive rights are a form of [[monopoly]].
Exclusive rights can be established by law or by contractual obligation, but the scope of enforceability will depend upon the extent to which others are bound by the instrument establishing the exclusive right; thus in the case of contractual rights, only persons that are parties to a contract will be affected by the exclusivity.
Exclusive rights may be granted in [[property law]], [[copyright law]], [[patent law]], in relation to [[public utility|public utilities]], or, in some jurisdictions, in other ''[[sui generis]]'' legislation. Many scholars argue that such rights form the basis for the concepts of [[property (ownership right)|property]] and [[ownership]].
Privately granted rights, created by [[contract]], may occasionally appear very similar to exclusive rights, but are only enforceable against the grantee, and not the world at large.
==Types of exclusive rights==
===Property===
In relation to [[property]], an exclusive right will, for the most part, arise when something tangible is acquired; as a result, others are prevented from exercising control of that thing. For example, a person may prohibit others from entering and using their [[real property|land]], or from taking their [[personal property|personal possessions]]. However, an exclusive right is not necessarily absolute, as an [[easement]] may allow a certain level of public access to [[private land]].
===Intellectual property===
Most [[government]]s recognize a [[Bundle of Rights|bundle of exclusive rights]] in relation to works of authorship, inventions, and identifications of origin. These rights are sometimes spoken of under the [[umbrella term]] "[[intellectual property]]."
==History and arguments==
In Anglo-Saxon property law, exclusive rights have often been the codification of pre-existing [[Norm (sociology)|social norm]]s with regard to land or [[Personal property|chattel]]s.
In [[continental Europe]] there is a view that copyrights, patents, and the like are the codification of some kind of [[Moral rights (copyright law)|moral right]], [[natural right]], or [[personamility rights|personalitlly right]]. However, such arguments can only be consistently justified through [[instrumentalism]] or [[consequentialism]], as exemplified by the reasoning inferred in [[Article One of the United States Constitution]] that copyrights and patents exist solely "To promote the Progress of Science and useful Arts."
==See also== *[[Moral rights]] *[[Natural and legal rights]]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Exclusive Right}} [[Category:Common law]] [[Category:Rights]]

{{more citations|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox publisher | name = Franz Eher Nachfolger | image = | caption = | parent = | status = | traded_as = | predecessor = | founded = 2 January 1887 | founder = [[Franz Eher]] | successor = [[Max Amann]] | country = [[Germany]] | headquarters = [[Munich]], [[Germany]] | distribution = | keypeople = [[Rolf Rienhard]]
Wilhelm Baur | publications = | topics = [[Politics]] | genre = | imprints = | revenue = | owner = | numemployees = | url = }} '''Franz Eher Nachfolger GmbH''' ("Franz Eher and Successors, LLC", usually referred to as the '''Eher-Verlag''' "Eher Publishing") was the central publishing house of the [[National Socialist German Workers Party|Nazi Party]] and one of the largest book and periodical firms during the [[Third Reich]].Norbert Frei/Johannes Schmitz: ''Journalismus im Dritten Reich''. 3. Aufl., C.H. Beck: München 1999, {{ISBN|3-406-45516-6}}Peter de Mendelssohn: ''Zeitungsstadt Berlin: Menschen und Mächte in der Geschichte der deutschen Presse Berlin''. Ullstein, 1959, 2., überarb. u. erw. Aufl., Frankfurt am Main, Berlin, Wien: Ullstein: 1982, {{ISBN|3-550-07496-4}}Thomas Tavernaro: ''Der Verlag Hitlers und der NSDAP. Die Franz Eher Nachfolger GmbH''. Edition Praesens: Wien 2004, {{ISBN|3-7069-0220-6}} It was acquired by the party on 17 December 1920 for 115,000 [[German papiermark|Papiermark]].[https://www.historisches-lexikon-bayerns.de/index.php5?title=Franz_Eher_Nachf._Verlag_(Zentralverlag_der_NSDAP)&oldid=58003 Paul Hoser. Franz Eher Nachf. Verlag (Zentralverlag der NSDAP) in Historisches Lexikon Bayerns (in German)] In addition to the major papers, the'' [[Völkischer Beobachter]]'' and the ''[[Illustrierter Beobachter]]'', the publishers also printed novels, maps, song books, and calendars. [[Adolf Hitler]]'s ''[[Mein Kampf]]'' was also published by the firm from 1925 through many editions and millions of copies. ==History== The publishing house was registered by [[Franz Xaver Josef Eher]] (1851-1918) in the [[Munich]] [[German Trade Register|Handelsregister]] on 2 December 1901. However, the firm was actually founded with the name ''Münchener Beobachter'' on 2 January 1887. After Eher's death, [[Rudolf von Sebottendorf]] took over the firm in 1918 and on 30 September 1919 transformed it into a [[Gesellschaft mit beschränkter Haftung|limited liability company]] in order to avoid possible bankruptcy. The headquarters were in [[Munich]] (Thierschstraße 11-17), and from 1933, the entire party literature was printed and published by Eher-Verlag. Later branches in Berlin, Vienna, and additional branches in Munich were established. Between 1933 and 1943, [[Rolf Rienhard]] was chief administrator. He was relieved by Wilhelm Baur, who remained until the end of the war. The key figure leading the publishing house's expansion, however, was [[Max Amann]], who took over the firm in the 1930s. He also doubled as Reich Press Leader and president of the Reich Press Chamber. In addition to the Eher-Verlag, he controlled nearly the entire economic function of the press in Germany. Often, Amann (in his government role) expropriated rival papers whose publishers were not willing to do the government's bidding. He then had the Eher-Verlag buy them for a pittance, usually in auctions in which the Eher-Verlag was the sole bidder. During the 1930s the Nazi Party purchased parts of the [[Alfred Hugenberg]] concerns and a number of other publishing houses. By the 1940s, these tactics turned the Eher Verlag into one of the largest newspaper chains in the world. In 1945, the publisher was banned and dismantled. The firm's buildings and intellectual property (including ''Mein Kampf'') were transferred to the state of [[Bavaria]]. ==Notable books== *Adolf Hitler. ''Mein Kampf'' (published 1925). *[[Alfred-Ingemar Berndt]]. ''[[Tanks Break Through!]] A German Soldier's Account of War in the Low Countries and France'', 1940. *[[Leo Leixner]]. ''[[From Lemberg to Bordeaux]] A German War Correspondent’s Account of Battle in Poland, the Low Countries and France, 1939-40'' (published 1941). ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Book publishing companies of Germany]] [[Category:Media in Munich]] [[Category:Companies based in Munich]] [[Category:Political book publishing companies]] [[Category:Nazi propaganda]] [[Category:Publishing companies established in 1887]] [[Category:Defunct publishing companies]] [[Category:Publishing companies disestablished in 1945]] [[Category:1887 establishments in Germany]] [[Category:1945 disestablishments in Germany]] [[Category:Companies involved in the Holocaust]]

The '''GI Rights Network''' is coalition of nonprofit, nongovernmental organizations that provide free and confidential information to [[United States military]] servicemembers, veterans, and their families. Most of the work of the Network is done through the GI Rights Hotline, but the Network also provides email counseling and live in-person counseling in some locales.[http://www.girightshotline.org/about/index.shtml GIRightshotline.org, "About the Network"] The Network also maintains a website with easy access to information about discharges, military regulations, GI rights, and other organizations; all information is available in both English and Spanish. ==GI Rights Hotline== The Network provides non-directive [[counseling]] to callers, with a particular focus on discharges and filing grievances. Counselors do not provide legal advice, but can assist callers in finding lawyers in their area who can give them appropriate advice.[http://www.girightshotline.org/about/index.shtml GIRightshotline.org, "About the Network"] Calls to the official national Hotline number 877-447-4487 are routed to different "nodes" of the network based on the area code of the caller. Hotline counselors come from a variety of backgrounds and include [[veterans]], mental health workers and attorneys, but most counselors are not attorneys and do not provide legal advice. ==History== The Network began in 1994 as a coalition of several organizations committed to peace and non-violence activism. The [[Central Committee for Conscientious Objectors]] served as the agent for the coalition for several years by managing the coalition's website, administering the national toll free phone number, and providing funding for a national coordinator for the Network.{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} In the fall of 2006, the Network members selected an "Advisory Council" to move the Network from an unincorporated association to a democratically operated corporation. The Network was incorporated in California in 2008. The Network member organizations adopted bylaws and elected a board of directors in 2009. ==In the news== In Harper's Magazine March 2005 Kathy Dobie's cover story "AWOL in America" cites the GI Rights Network as "a national referral and counseling service for military personnel," and uses its counselors as sources for the story. "On August 23, 2004, I interviewed Robert Dove, a burly, bearded Quaker, in the Boston offices of the American Friends Service Committee, one of the groups involved with the hot line. Dove told me of getting frantic calls from the parents of recruits, and of recruits who are so appalled by basic training that they "can't eat, they literally vomit every time they put a spoon to their mouths, they're having nightmares and wetting their beds."{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} In a Chicago Public Radio Interview "Going AWOL – A Hotline that Helps GIs Consider Their Options," (12-12-06) GI Rights counselor, Steve Woolford, explains the reasons why many servicemen and women go AWOL from military service.[http://www.wbez.org/content.aspx?audioID=661] In her second place Hearst Journalism Award Winning features piece "Sincere Disapproval"[http://hearstfdn.org/hearst_journalism/competitions.php?type=Writing&year=2007&id=2] author Leah Lohse references the GI Rights Network for its expertise in dealing with conscientious objection. The story gives a view into the beliefs and struggles of one particular conscientious objector. A USA Today story on 4/1/2009, "Army investigating unfit soldiers sent to war," cited The GI Rights Hotline for assisting servicemembers who were being deployed with disabilities and other medical problems.[https://www.usatoday.com/news/military/2009-03-31-army-inquiry_N.htm]
[Army Sgt. Jesse] Raymo said he and others had exhausted their efforts to complain to supervisors and felt their only recourse was working with the GI Rights Hotline to draft a petition outlining their claims of mistreatment to send to members of Congress. He said more than 200 signatures have been gathered, most of them from civilians, and another petition signing event is being planned.{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}}
==Current Network Membership== Current members and associate members of the Network include (this list includes groups who do not get "routed" calls from the Network but do provide other essential services to the Network as a whole):[http://www.girightshotline.org/contact/index.shtml GIRightsHotline.org - List of Member Groups] * Humboldt Committee for Conscientious Objectors (Arcata, CA){{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} * North County San Diego GI Rights Hotline, (Carlsbad, CA){{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} * San Diego Military Counseling Project[http://www.sdmcp.org/] * [[Military Law Task Force]] of the [[National Lawyers Guild]] * American Friends Service Committee (San Francisco, CA)[http://www.afsc.org American Friends Service Committee] * Resource Center For Nonviolence (Santa Cruz, CA)[http://rcnv.org/] * [[Center on Conscience & War]] (CCW)[http://www.centeronconscience.org/index.shtml] * [[Military Counseling Network]] (Bammental, Germany)[http://www.mc-network.de/] * [[Catholic Peace Fellowship]][http://www.catholicpeacefellowship.org] * American Friends Service Committee-North East Regional Office, (Cambridge, MA)[http://www.afsc.org/newengland/cambridge.htm] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080709142044/http://www.afsc.org/newengland/cambridge.htm |date=July 9, 2008 }} * [[Quaker House]] Of Fayetteville, NC[http://quakerhouse.org] * [[War Resisters League]][http://www.warresisters.org/] * [[Oklahoma GI Rights Hotline]] (Oklahoma City, OK)[http://okgirightshotline.org/] * Seattle Draft And Military Counseling Center (Seattle, WA){{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} * New Mexico GI Rights Hotline (Albuquerque, NM)[http://abqpeaceandjustice.org/gihotline.html] * Flint Hills GI Rights Hotline (Manhattan, KS)[http://www.flinthillsgirights.com] ==See also== *[[Coffee Strong]]—a Tacoma, Washington based coffeehouse based on Vietnam era GI resistance coffeehouses *[[List of anti-war organizations]] *[[List of peace activists]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{anti-war}} {{DEFAULTSORT:GI Rights Network}} [[Category:1994 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:Anti-conscription organizations]] [[Category:Anti–Iraq War groups]] [[Category:Conscientious objection organizations]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1994]] [[Category:Peace organizations]] [[Category:United States military support organizations]] [[Category:Veterans' affairs in the United States]]

{{Infobox Geopolitical organization | name = Gas Exporting Countries Forum (GECF) | linking_name = the Gas Exporting Countries Forum | symbol_type = Logo | image_symbol = GECF Logo.jpg | symbol_width = 150px | image_map = GasOPEC.PNG | map_caption = Members (blue) and observers (orange) of the Gas-Exporting Countries Forum. | org_type = Trade forum | membership_type = Members[https://www.gecf.org/gecfmembers/gecf-countries GECF Members & Observers] GECF | membership = {{collapsible list |titlestyle = background:transparent;text-align:left;font-weight:normal; |title = 12 states |{{flagcountry|Algeria}} |{{flagcountry|Bolivia}} |{{flagcountry|Egypt}} |{{flagcountry|Equatorial Guinea}} |{{flagcountry|Iran}} |{{flagcountry|Libya}} |{{flagcountry|Nigeria}} |{{flagcountry|Qatar}} |{{flagcountry|Russia}} |{{nowrap|{{flagcountry|Trinidad and Tobago}}}} |{{flagcountry|United Arab Emirates}}|{{flagcountry|Venezuela}} |
}} {{collapsible list |titlestyle = background:transparent;text-align:left;font-weight:normal; |title = 7 observers |{{flagcountry|Azerbaijan}}|{{flagcountry|Iraq}}|{{flagcountry|Kazakhstan}} |{{flagcountry|Netherlands}} |{{flagcountry|Norway}} |{{flagcountry|Oman}} |{{flagcountry|Peru}} }} | established = [[Tehran]], [[Iran]] | established_event1 = Forum | established_date1 = May 20, 2001 | admin_center_type = Headquarters | admin_center = {{nowrap|[[Doha]], [[Qatar]]}} | languages_type = Official language | languages = [[English language|English]] | leader_title1 = {{nowrap|Secretary General}} | leader_name1 = {{nowrap|Yury Sentyurin}} | established_event2 = Statute | established_date2 = December 23, 2008 | area_magnitude = | area_km2 = 26965287.87 | area_sq_mi = | population_estimate = 599,861,442 | population_density_km2 = {{#expr: 599861442 / 26965287.87 round 1}} | official_website = {{URL|www.gecf.org}} }} [[File:Participants in the 7th meeting of the Gas Exporting Countries' Forum in Moscow.jpg|thumb|[[Dmitry Medvedev]] and the participants in the seventh ministerial meeting of the Gas Exporting Countries' Forum (GECF), [[Moscow Kremlin]], 2008.]] [[File:The Second Gas Summit 1.jpg|thumb|[[Vladimir Putin]] and the participants in the meeting of the heads of state and government of the Gas Exporting Countries Forum (GECF), [[Moscow Kremlin]], 2013.]] [[File:Third GECF summit in Tehran 50.jpg|thumb|[[Hassan Rouhani]] chairs the [[Third GECF summit]], 22 May 2015]] The '''Gas Exporting Countries Forum''' ('''GECF''') is an [[intergovernmental organization]] of 11 of the world's leading [[natural gas]] producers made up of [[Algeria]], [[Bolivia]], [[Egypt]], [[Equatorial Guinea]], [[Iran]], [[Libya]], [[Nigeria]], [[Qatar]], [[Russia]], [[Trinidad and Tobago]] and [[Venezuela]]. GECF members together control over 70% of the world's natural gas reserves, 38% of the pipeline trade and 85% of the [[liquefied natural gas]] (LNG) production.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/12/10/natural-gas-exporting-trade-opinions-contributors-marcel-dietsch.html?sp=true |title=The Next Global Energy Cartel |author=Marcel Dietsch |publisher=[[Forbes]] |date=2009-12-10 |accessdate=2010-04-23}} The three largest reserve-holders in the GECF{{spaced ndash}}[[Russia]], [[Iran]] and [[Qatar]]{{spaced ndash}}together hold about 57% of global gas reserves. == History == The GECF was established in [[Tehran]], [[Iran]], in 2001. Until the seventh ministerial meeting in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]], it operated without charter and fixed membership structure. The seventh ministerial meeting, held on 23 December 2008 in Moscow, adapted the organization's charter. {{cite news| url = https://uk.reuters.com/article/businessIndustry/idUKTRE4BL3G020081223?sp=true | title = Russia hosts new gas body, faces OPEC ire over oil | author = Katya Golubkova, Amie Ferris-Rotman | publisher = [[Reuters]] | date = 2008-12-23 | accessdate = 2008-12-23}} At the same time, it was decided to set up an Executive Office and a Secretariat in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]]. On the eighth ministerial meeting in June 2009, energy minister of Qatar [[Abdullah bin Hamad Al Attiyah]] was elected as the chairman (president) of the GECF and Algerian energy minister [[Chakib Khelil]] was elected as vice-chairman. {{cite news | url = https://www.arabianoilandgas.com/article-5794-qatar_energy_chief_says_uae_to_join_gas_forum/ | title = Qatar energy chief says UAE to join gas forum | author = Kevin Baxter | publisher = ITP Business Publishing Ltd. | work = ArabianOilandGas.com | date = 2009-07-02 | accessdate = 2009-07-02}} {{cite news | url = https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=ao3fGMSgFHO0 | title = Gas Producers Count on Oil-Linked Contracts in Qatar | author = Ayesha Daya, Robert Tuttle | publisher = Bloomberg | date = 2009-06-30 | accessdate = 2009-07-02}} {{cite news | url = https://www.moscowtimes.ru/article/600/42/379175.htm |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130113212930/http://www.moscowtimes.ru/article/600/42/379175.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-01-13 |title=Russia Fails to Offer Gas Candidate |author=Anatoly Medetsky |publisher=The Moscow Times |date=2009-07-01 |accessdate=2009-07-02 }} On the ninth ministerial meeting in December 2009, the vice-president of Russian energy engineering and construction company [[Stroytransgaz]] [[Leonid Bokhanovsky]] was elected as Secretary-General. {{cite news | url = https://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKGEE5B81KB20091209 | title = Five facts about Russian head of gas grouping | publisher = [[Reuters]] | date = 2009-12-09 | accessdate = 2009-12-12}} He was re-elected at the thirteenth ministerial meeting in December 2011. {{cite news | url = https://english.ruvr.ru/2011/11/13/60313887.html | title = Russian diplomat retains top GECF post | agency = [[ITAR-TASS|TASS]] | work = [[Voice of Russia]] | date = 2011-11-13 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} In 2013, GECF ministers elected Iran’s candidate Mohammad-Hossein Adeli, a former head of central bank and diplomat, as the new Secretary-General of the forum for the next two years. == Objectives == The objectives of the GECF are:{{Citation needed|date=July 2013}} * to foster the concept of mutuality of interests by favoring dialogue between producers, between producers and consumers and between governments and energy-related industries; * to provide a platform to promote study and exchange of views; * to promote a stable and transparent energy market. == Organisational structure == The highest body of the GECF is a ministerial meeting. In between of ministerial meetings, the work is organized through the Secretariat, headquartered in Doha, Qatar. The 2009 chairman of the GECF was [[Abdullah bin Hamad Al Attiyah]] and the vice chairman was [[Chakib Khelil]]. The Secretary-General is Leonid Bokhanovsky. ===Secretaries-General=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Name ! Country ! Service Period |- |Leonid Bokhanovsky |{{flag|Russia}} |9 December 2009 – 1 January 2014 (2 Term) |- |[[Mohammad Hossein Adeli]] |{{flag|Iran}} |1 January 2014 – 12 January 2018 (2 Term) |- |Yury Sentyurin |{{flag|Russia}} |12 January 2018 – present |- |} ===Ministerial meetings=== The GECF has had ministerial meetings since 2001:https://www.gecf.org/events/list/ministerial-meetings?p=1 {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! colspan="2" | Location !! Year |- | colspan="2" | [[Tehran]], [[Iran]] || 2001 |- | colspan="2" | [[Algiers]], [[Algeria]] || 2002 |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2003 |- | colspan="2" | [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]] || 2004 |- | colspan="2" | [[Port of Spain]], [[Trinidad and Tobago]] || 2005 |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2007 |- | colspan="2" | [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] || 2008 |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2009 (June) |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2009 (December) |- | colspan="2" | [[Oran]], [[Algeria]] || 2010 (April) |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2010 (December) |- | colspan="2" | [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]] || 2011 (June) |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2011 (November) |- | colspan="2" | [[Malabo]], [[Equatorial Guinea]] || 2012 |- | colspan="2" | [[Tehran]], [[Iran]]{{cite news|title=Iran's Oil Minister Appointed GECF Head|url=http://www.mees.com/en/articles/8276-irans-oil-minister-apointed-gecf-head|accessdate=13 September 2013|work=Mees|date=21 August 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130913153736/http://www.mees.com/en/articles/8276-irans-oil-minister-apointed-gecf-head|archivedate=13 September 2013|df=}} || 2013 |- | colspan="2" | [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] || 2014 |- | colspan="2" | [[Tehran]], [[Iran]]https://www.gecf.org/events/17th-ministerial-meeting-of-the-gas-exporting-countries-forum || 2015 |} ===Summits=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Meeting ! Country ! Year |- | I |{{flag|Qatar}}, [[Doha]] | 15 November 2011 |- | II | {{flag|Russia}}, {{cite news | url = https://english.ruvr.ru/2011/11/15/60446073.html | title = Russia ready to host 2nd GECF summit | agency = [[Information Telegraph Agency of Russia|TASS]] | work = [[Voice of Russia]] | date = 2011-11-15 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} [[Moscow]] |1 July 2013https://www.gecf.org/events/third-gecf-gas-summit |- | [[Third GECF summit|III]] | {{flag|Iran}}, [[Tehran]] | 23 November 2015 |- | IV | {{flag|Bolivia}}, [[Santa Cruz de la Sierra]] | 24 November 2017[https://www.gecf.org/events/fourth-gecf-gas-summit Fourth GECF Gas Summit] |} Holding the GECF's summit was decided at the 10th ministerial meeting in Oran in 2010. The first GECF's summit was held in Doha on 15 November 2011, under patronage of [[Emir]] [[Sheikh Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani]], following the thirteenth ministerial meeting held at the same place on 13 November 2011. {{cite news | url = https://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=470095&version=1&template_id=48&parent_id=28 | title = GECF gas summit focuses on stable supplies, markets | newspaper = Gulf Times | date = 2011-11-15 | accessdate = 2011-11-15 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20111115143317/http://gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=470095&version=1&template_id=48&parent_id=28 |archivedate = 2011-11-15 |df = }} Two main issues which were discussed at the summit, were natural gas prices and a common approach to the natural gas market. {{cite news | url = https://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,15539025,00.html | title = Global 'gas cartel' is a long way off, experts say | agency = [[Deutsche Welle]] | first = Insa | last = Wrede | date = 2011-11-17 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} It was agreed on the summit that the price of gas used to generate electricity is too low and the gap between prices for gas and [[crude oil]] need to be narrowed. The linking of gas prices to the [[oil price]] was considered. However, the GECF will not set output limits for its members. {{cite news | url = https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-11-15/natural-gas-exporters-seek-high-prices-as-they-cooperate-on-supply.html | title = Gas Exporters Seek 'High' Prices as They Cooperate on Supply, Projects | agency = [[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] | date = 2011-11-15 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} The [[final communique]] issued was the [https://web.archive.org/web/20120523135016/https://portal.opec.mop.ir/Documents/BAYANIE-GECF-LATIN.pdf Doha Declaration], which read that GECF members "recognized the importance of long-term gas contracts to achieve a balanced risk sharing mechanism between producers and consumers" and "acknowledge the need to reach a fair price for natural gas based on gas to oil/oil products prices indexation with the objective of an oil and gas price convergence ..." {{cite news | url = https://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=470366&version=1&template_id=57&parent_id=56 | title = Doha summit urges fair price for gas | newspaper = [[Gulf Times]] | first = Pratap | last = John | date = 2011-11-16 | accessdate = 2011-11-18 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20111116160100/http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=470366&version=1&template_id=57&parent_id=56 |archivedate = 2011-11-16 |df = }} {{cite news | url = https://www.menafn.com/qn_news_story_s.asp?storyid=1093456841 | title = First Summit of Gas Exporting Countries Forum Concludes in Doha | agency = MENAFN | date = 2011-11-16 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} Russian president [[Dmitry Medvedev]] made a statement calling the summit "an important event, which marked a new stage in the development of the global energy sector and the gas sector in particular." {{cite news | url = https://english.ruvr.ru/2011/11/15/60432948.html | title = Medvedev welcomes 1st GESF summit in Doha | agency = [[Information Telegraph Agency of Russia|TASS]] | work = [[Voice of Russia]] | date = 2011-11-15 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} == Membership == The members are Algeria, Bolivia, Egypt, Equatorial Guinea, Iran, Libya, Nigeria, Qatar, Russia, Trinidad and Tobago and Venezuela. {{cite news | url = https://www.upi.com/Business_News/Energy-Resources/2011/11/14/Oman-joins-GECF-natural-gas-cartel/UPI-41981321288235/ | title = Oman joins GECF natural gas cartel | agency = [[United Press International|UPI]] | date = 2011-11-14 | accessdate = 2011-11-15}} Kazakhstan,[https://web.archive.org/web/20151124015245/http://presstv.com/Detail/2015/11/23/438844/Iran-Venezuela-Rouhani-Maduro-GECF-oil-producers] Netherlands, Iraq, Oman, Peru, Azerbaijan and Norway are observers.[https://web.archive.org/web/20151122234915/http://presstv.com/Detail/2015/11/21/438618/Adeli-again-picked-as-GECF-SecGeneral] Other countries like Turkmenistan, Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, the United Arab Emirates, and Yemen have participated at different meetings. {{cite news | url = https://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-12/24/content_10552504.htm | title = World gas producers approve charter for Doha-based forum | publisher = Xinhua | date = 2008-12-24 | accessdate = 2008-12-26}} {{cite news | title=Putin says 'cheap gas era' ending | publisher = BBC | date=2008-12-23 | url=https://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7796806.stm | accessdate = 2008-12-23}} {{cite news | url = http://www.rferl.org/content/NaturalGas_Producers_Meeting_In_Moscow_To_Finalize_Forum/1362739.html | title = Russia Says Gas Forum Will Not Be OPEC-Like Cartel | publisher = RFE/RL | date = 2008-12-23 | accessdate = 2008-12-23}} Yemen and Angola are interested to become members of the organisation. {{cite news | url = https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aVpnIgf_IE2k | title = Yemen in Talks to Join Gas Exporting Countries Forum | publisher = [[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] | author = Ahmed Rouaba | date = 2010-04-19 | accessdate = 2010-04-22}} {{cite news | url = https://www.macauhub.com.mo/en/news.php?ID=9289 | title = Angola may join Gas Exporting Countries Forum | publisher = MacauHub | date = 2010-04-20 | accessdate = 2010-04-22}} The full membership will be granted by the approval of at least three quarters of all members. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="width:150px;"| Country ! style="width:150px;"| Region ! style="width:150px;"| Signed GECF
statute |- | {{flag|Algeria}} | [[MENA]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Bolivia}} | [[South America]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Egypt}} | [[MENA]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Equatorial Guinea}} | [[Sub-Saharan Africa]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Iran}} | [[MENA]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Libya}} | [[MENA]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Nigeria}} | [[Sub-Saharan Africa]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Qatar}} | [[MENA]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Russia}} | [[Eurasia]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|Trinidad and Tobago}} | [[South America]] | align=center |2008 |- | {{flag|UAE}} | [[MENA]] | align=center |2012https://www.arabianbusiness.com/uae-joins-gas-exporting-countries-forum-458037.html |- | {{flag|Venezuela}} | [[South America]] | align=center |2008 |} == Gas OPEC == Since the establishment of the GECF in 2001 there has always been speculation that some of the world's largest producers of natural gas, in particular Russia and Iran, intend to create a gas cartel equivalent to [[OPEC]] which would set quotas and prices. The idea of a gas OPEC was first floated by then Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] and backed by Kazakh President [[Nursultan Nazarbaev]] in 2002. In May 2006 [[Gazprom]] deputy chairman [[Alexander Medvedev]] threatened that Russia would create "an alliance of gas suppliers that will be more influential than OPEC" if Russia did not get its way in energy negotiations with Europe. {{cite news | url = https://www.rferl.org/content/article/1070561.html | title = Russia: Algeria Deal Revives Talk Of Gas Cartel | author = Roman Kupchinsky | publisher = RFE/RL | date = 2006-08-14 | accessdate = 2008-12-23}} Iranian officials have explicitly expressed strong support for a gas cartel and held official talks with Russia. {{cite news | url = https://money.cnn.com/2007/02/02/news/international/natural_gas/index.htm? | title = Russia, Iran in talks to create natural gas organization | agency = CNN | date = 2007-02-02 | accessdate = 2008-12-23}} Cartel speculation was again raised when the ministers met on 9 April 2007. {{cite news | url = https://news.bbc.co.http://rt.com/Business/2009-12-11/shmatko-gecf-opec-gas.htmluk/2/hi/middle_east/6538127.stm | title = Gas producers 'to discuss cartel' | publisher = [[BBC]] | date = 2007-04-09 | accessdate = 2007-04-10 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20091214043924/http://rt.com/Business/2009-12-11/shmatko-gecf-opec-gas.html |archivedate = 2009-12-14 |df = }} The 6th Ministerial Meeting of the GECF established an expert group, chaired by Russia, to study how to strengthen the GECF. According to the Algerian Energy and Mines Minister [[Chakib Khelil]], this mean that in the long term the GECF will move toward becoming a gas OPEC. {{cite news | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/businessNews/idUSL0920522920070409 | title = Gas club seeks more clout, but not yet an OPEC | author = Barbara Lewis, Simon Webb | publisher = [[Reuters]] | date = 2007-04-09 | accessdate = 2007-04-09}} On 11 December 2009, Russia's Energy Minister [[Sergey Shmatko]] stated: "Today we can speak about gas OPEC as a fully fledged international organization. By a unanimous decision a Russian national was elected its secretary general. This is to show that member countries expect Russia to use its political weight to promote it." {{cite news | url = https://rt.com/Business/2009-12-11/shmatko-gecf-opec-gas.html | title = Shmatko predicts strong role of GECF | publisher = [[RT (TV network)|RT]] | date = 2009-12-11 | accessdate = 2009-12-12}} Creation of the "Gas OPEC" was one of the topics of the first GECF's summit. However, some GECF's members are concerned over the gas exports to be politicized. {{cite news | url = https://english.ruvr.ru/2011/11/14/60354788.html | title = A gas OPEC to dominate GECF summit in Doha, Russia not present | first = Vladimir | last = Fedoruk | work = [[Voice of Russia]] | date = 2011-11-14 | accessdate = 2011-11-18}} == See also == {{portal|Energy}} *[[Energy security]] *[[Energy superpower]] *[[Petrochemical Exporting Countries Forum]] == References == {{reflist|2}} == Bibliography == *{{Cite book |last= Hallouche |first= Hadi |title= The Gas Exporting Countries Forum: Is it really a Gas OPEC in the Making? |url= https://www.oxfordenergy.org/pdfs/NG13.pdf |format= PDF |date=June 2006 |publisher= [[Oxford Institute for Energy Studies]] |isbn= 978-1-901795-50-9 |accessdate= 2008-12-26 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090327021423/http://www.oxfordenergy.org/pdfs/NG13.pdf |archivedate = 2009-03-27 |df =}} *{{Cite journal |last= Socor |first= Vladimir |title= A Russian-led "OPEC for Gas"? Design, Implications, Countermeasures |url= https://www.lfpr.lt/uploads/File/2008-20/Socor_ENG.pdf |format= PDF |journal = Lithuanian Foreign Policy Review |year = 2008 |issue = 20 |publisher= Foreign Policy Research Center |issn= 1392-5504 |accessdate= 2008-12-26 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090327021421/http://www.lfpr.lt/uploads/File/2008-20/Socor_ENG.pdf |archivedate = 2009-03-27 |df = }} *{{Cite book |last= Flynn |first=Chris |author2=Dyer, Erin |title= The International Comparative Legal Guide to: Gas Regulation 2008 |year= 2008 |pages=1–3 |publisher=Global Legal Group |chapter= The Creation of a Gas Cartel v The Commoditisation of Gas |chapterurl= https://www.iclg.co.uk/khadmin/Publications/pdf/1778.pdf |accessdate=2008-12-26}} == External links == {{commons}} * [http://www.gecf.org/ GECF.org] * [http://www.ensec.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=171:gas-exporting-countries-forum-the-russian-iranian-gas-cartel&catid=90:energysecuritydecember08&Itemid=334 Gas Exporting Countries Forum: The Russian-Iranian Gas Cartel] {{Petroleum industry}} {{Energy in Iran}} [[Category:2001 establishments in Iran]] [[Category:Energy economics]] [[Category:Energy policy]] [[Category:International energy organizations]] [[Category:International trade organizations]] [[Category:Natural gas organizations]] [[Category:Organizations established in 2001]] [[Category:Intergovernmental organizations]] [[Category:GECF]] [[Category:Intergovernmental commodity organizations|Gas]] [[Category:Organisations based in Doha]]

revision.comment: Typo/[[WP:AWB/GF|general]] fixes, replaced: Sopinksy → Sopinsky per http://brandonsopinsky.com/home/ assuming this is the same artist, [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: high profile → high-profile using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox organization | name = Global Inheritance | logo = Global-Inheritance-Logo .png | founded_date = 2002 | founder = Eric Ritz | location = Los Angeles | homepage = [http://www.globalinheritance.org/about-us/ globalinheritance.org]}} '''Global Inheritance''' is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization based in Los Angeles, California working to empower individuals worldwide to think and act creatively in solving global issues. The group’s initiatives focus on the power of creativity to communicate and drive progressive social change. Founded in 2002 by Eric Ritz, Global Inheritance has specialized in reaching young audiences to create awareness of environmental and social issues.[http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-treehugger21jan21,0,1480961.story Ad exec has flair for pushing green - latimes.com] Because they tailor their work to each specific subculture and event, Global Inheritance has been uniquely successful in reaching audiences around the world. The organization is especially known for its work in making major events such as [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival]], ESPN [[X Games]] and [[Indianapolis 500|Indy 500]] more environmentally friendly. Using a variety of programs, from artist-designed recycling bins and recycling incentive programs to energy generating playgrounds and carpool initiatives, Global Inheritance helps events reduce their environmental impact and raise awareness among attendees.[http://liveearth.org/en/liveearthblog/coachella-continues-with-green-initiatives Coachella Continues with Green Initiatives | Live Earth] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100615223319/http://liveearth.org/en/liveearthblog/coachella-continues-with-green-initiatives |date=2010-06-15 }}[http://www.miller-mccune.com/science-environment/music-festivals-offering-a-greener-listening-experience-13562/ Music Festivals Show How to Green a Large Outdoor Event - Miller-McCune] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100625030857/http://www.miller-mccune.com/science-environment/music-festivals-offering-a-greener-listening-experience-13562/ |date=2010-06-25 }} ==Initiatives== [[File:Coachella-TRASHed.png|thumb|right|Coachella featured Global Inheritance's TRASHed :: Art of Recycling campaign in which artists from across the nation designed recycling bins for some friendly competition and a love of art.]] Global Inheritance promotes environmental education, sustainability, and social action through a variety of projects, each catered to the specific audience. Below are some of the group's most well-known initiatives. ===TRASHed :: Art of Recycling=== This program bridges art and environmental responsibility to bring new attention to the practice of recycling. Artists redesign empty recycling bins in order to inspire event goers to not only recycle, but to also take ownership in the larger concept of activism. The redesigned bins create eye-catching works that Global Inheritance brings to events across the country, such as Coachella, which has supported the program since 2004. The festival has showcased over a thousand recycling bins over the last eight years, each one an original piece created by artists from around the world.{{cite web |url=http://www.coachella.com/updates/news |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-01-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071213011312/http://www.coachella.com/updates/news |archivedate=2007-12-13 |df= }} Past artists have included Hunter S. Thompson, Blink-182 and Fugazi.[https://www.flickr.com/photos/74696088@N00/collections/72157624350635738/ Collection: TRASHed :: Art Of Recycling] Each year, Global Inheritance donates the decorated bins to local schools, enabling their message to reach an even wider audience and inspire the next generation of activists. ===TRASHed :: Recycling Store=== The TRASHed :: Recycling Store is another program that has been very successful in reducing the environmental footprints of major events, such as Warped Tour, X Games, Virgin Music Festival, Stagecoach Festival, Outside Lands Festival, Coachella (under the title, 10 for 1 Bottle Exchange), Ultra Festival, Treasure Island and more. Founded in 2003, the TRASHed :: Recycling Store has inspired other festivals around the globe including Bonnaroo and Lollapalooza to create incentive based recycling programs. The store awards points for rogue bottles, cans and biodegradable cups that individuals collect in order to encourage people to keep the grounds clean. These points can be exchanged for prizes that range from Loomstate jeans and backstage passes to skateboard decks and autographed memorabilia, depending on the interests of the venue. {{cite web |url=http://disney.go.com/environmentality/xgames/summerxgames13/trashed.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-06-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091225085137/http://disney.go.com/environmentality/xgames/summerxgames13/trashed.html |archivedate=2009-12-25 |df= }} ===Energy FACTory=== Launched at the 2007 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival, the Energy FACTory is an interactive, energy-making museum that uses different mediums to educate the public about renewable energy sources. Through installations, workshops and/or demonstrations, the Energy FACTory provides a unique platform to educate people about wind, solar, bio-diesel, ethanol, thermal, kinetic energy, as well as the truths about other types of non-renewable energy. The Energy FACTory has featured everything from re-engineered golf carts inspired by different Coachella artists, such as an Amy Winehouse ethanol golf cart and a Yeah Yeah Yeahs biodiesel golf cart, to wind powered clock towers, human powered DJ Stages, and educational workshops. The size of the installation can vary from a single stationary bike or listening station to an entire playground depending on the venue. [[File:Energy-Playground-Coachella.jpg|thumb|right|The Energy Playground provides Coachella Music & Arts Festival attendees a great opportunity to recharge their phone and rethink the way they consume power]] ===Energy Playground=== A spin off of the Energy FACTory, first seen at Coachella 2010 under the name "Sweatshop Mixer" and also appearing as “Prius Playground”, “High Plains Mixer”, and “Energy FACTory DJ Mixer”, the Energy Playground consists of bikes, swings, human sized hamster wheels, seesaws, and hand cranks. All of the equipment is set up to harness the energy that is produced by using them. The energy is then converted into electricity to power anything from snow cone machines and cell phone chargers to entire DJ sets. The majority of electricity produced by the playground is stored in the Energy Well, a fully monitor-able and adaptable lithium-ion battery command center. As electricity flows from production devices into the Energy Well, software tracks all aspects of production and can share, in real time, the results of riders’ work. This incentive aims to further introduce people to alternative forms of energy while at the same time realizing the impact, big or small, that they can make as one person or as a group. [[File:The-Bigger-Picture-Logo.png|thumb|right|The Bigger Picture Film Awards rewards the best cause-based films and documentaries as acclaimed by the public]] ===The Bigger Picture=== Launched in 2008, The Bigger Picture Film Awards rewards the best cause-based films and documentaries as acclaimed by the public. Participants vote online to support movies highlighting the most pressing issues of our time. Award categories are separated between feature films and documentaries. With the Bigger Picture Film Awards, each voter is encouraged to share their favorite nominees within personal network of friends, family and fellow peers. Every voter is automatically entered to win incredible prizes for their involvement and contribution to make the world see the bigger picture. Once the votes are in, Global Inheritance hosts a ceremony in Los Angeles, CA where film producers, actors and movie industry executives gather to receive their awards and celebrate the causes they’re all defending. The 2017 Bigger Picture Film Awards was held at the Ace Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles on March 1. {| class="wikitable" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; border: none;" |+ '''The Bigger Picture Film Awards 2017''' ! scope="col" |
Awards ! scope="col" |
